---
title: "Getting Started"
---

## Installing

```bash
quarto add Data-Wise/dtslides
```

This installs both themes (Academic and UNM) under `_extensions/`. Check the directory into version control. Requires Quarto >= 1.6.0.

## Updating

```bash
quarto update Data-Wise/dtslides
```

This replaces the extension files under `_extensions/` while preserving your `.qmd` files and any custom SCSS overrides.

## Upgrading from unm-revealjs

If you previously used the `unm-revealjs` extension (v1.0.x):

1. Remove the old extension:

   ```bash
   rm -rf _extensions/unm
   ```

2. Install the new extension:

   ```bash
   quarto add Data-Wise/dtslides
   ```

3. Update your YAML front matter:

   ```yaml
   # Before
   format:
     unm-revealjs:
       slide-number: c/t

   # After
   format:
     dtslides-unm-revealjs:
       slide-number: c/t
   ```

All CSS classes, callouts, and slide options work the same way — only the format string changed.

## Using the Themes

### Academic theme

```yaml
---
title: "My Presentation"
format:
  dtslides-revealjs:
    slide-number: c/t
---
```

### UNM theme

```yaml
---
title: "My Presentation"
format:
  dtslides-unm-revealjs:
    slide-number: c/t
---
```

## Customizing Colors and Fonts {#customizing}

Quarto's YAML-level font options (`mainfont`, `fontsize`, `monofont`) are silently ignored for RevealJS presentations. All typography must be controlled through SCSS.

To customize, create a `custom.scss` file and layer it after the extension theme:

```yaml
format:
  dtslides-revealjs:
    theme: [custom.scss]
    slide-number: c/t
```

### Example `custom.scss`

```scss
/*-- scss:defaults --*/

// --- Override fonts ---
$font-family-sans-serif: "Georgia", serif;
$font-family-heading: "Playfair Display", serif;
$font-family-monospace: "JetBrains Mono", monospace;

// --- Override sizes ---
$font-size-root: 36px;
$presentation-h2-font-size: 1.4em;

// --- Override colors ---
$primary: #2C3E50;
$accent: #E74C3C;

// --- Override spacing ---
$line-height-body: 1.6;

// --- Override code blocks ---
$code-block-font-size: 0.7em;
$code-block-bg: #f5f5f5;
```

The extension's SCSS uses `!default` on key variables, so your overrides take precedence.

## CSS Specificity Notes

When writing custom CSS rules for RevealJS, use the `.reveal` prefix to match the framework's specificity:

```css
/* Headings — bare h2 loses to RevealJS defaults */
.reveal h2 { color: #2C3E50; }

/* Quarto callouts — need div.callout to match specificity */
.reveal div.callout-note { border-color: #007bff; }

/* List items */
.reveal .slide ul li { margin-bottom: 0.5em; }
```
